title: Dr. Shaun stops an ongoing surgery
description: Watch Dr. Shaun intervene during a procedure. Learn vocabulary related to surgery protocols.

vocabulary.def: Completely clean and free from bacteria
A set of rules or procedures
The presence of harmful substances or infection
To step in or take action to prevent harm

questions.question: Why does Dr. Shaun stop the surgery?

options.text: He notices an anomaly not seen on scans
He is tired and needs a break

questions.feedback: Correct! He saw an anomaly that could cause complications.

questions.question: Complete the quote: 'We need to close the ___ immediately.'
questions.feedback: Correct. They need to close the surgical cut.

questions.question: What word describes a 'set of rules to follow'?
questions.feedback: Correct. Breaking protocol is a serious issue in surgery.

questions.question: Dr. Lim warns: 'If we continue, thereâ€™s a high risk of ___.'
questions.feedback: Correct. Unexpected anomalies lead to complications.

questions.question: Dr. Shaun decides to ___ despite the risk of breaking protocol.
questions.feedback: Correct. To intervene means to step in and stop the action.

questions.question: The team checks for possible ___ of the surgical field.
questions.feedback: Correct. Contamination makes the area unsafe for surgery.

questions.question: It is crucial to keep the instruments ___.
questions.feedback: Correct. Sterile means free from bacteria.
